summary: Richard N. Billings was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list Billings as an employee. These documents detail his employment with the committee during various periods in 1978, including April, August, and December. The reports list his name, salary, and gross pay during those periods, indicating his role as a staff member within the committee.
significance: Richard N. Billings' significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). While the provided documents do not specify his exact role within the committee, his presence on payroll and certification reports indicates he was a staff member involved in the investigation of the JFK assassination. The documents suggest his involvement spanned from at least April to December 1978.
